message.content:
In some instances, children can be smarter than adults. Intelligence is not strictly age-dependent; it has to do with factors like genetics, environment, and experiences. Children may have the advantage of absorbing information more quickly than adults as their brains are still developing and have greater plasticity.

Specifically, in areas related to modern technology or new concepts that they grew up with the exposure of these latest advancements can sometimes make them excel.

There could also be situations where a child might exhibit higher critical thinking skills or problem-solving abilities compared to an adult because of varying individual potentials or upbringing.

However, on average and generally speaking, adults tend to possess more knowledge and experience which allows them a better understanding of various subjects comparatively.
